dialogues.text: VD, Syphilis, Gonorrhea, AIDS--

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANDEBAUM
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, slow down. What the hell happened?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Just give me the test, Morty. And I need the results as soon as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving home from the airport - a HUGE bouquet of roses w a "Welcome Home" card sits in between Barney and Miriam. Barney is conspicuously silent and nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk in from the airport. Barney's acting strange. Both anxious and nice. Too nice.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: It's good to be home.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Let me put these in water and I'll unpack your bags. Go, relax.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: I have a better idea. She wraps her arms around his waist and kisses him; she's the mood for love.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I missed you.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I missed you too. He squirms out of her arms and carries the roses to the kitchen, talking from the other room.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But you must be exhausted - I'll put on some tea - and run you a bath how does that sound? She follows him into the kitchen.  WHITE 10-23-09 116.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barney fills a GLASS VASE with water

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Nothing. Why?

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Barney... The phone RINGS. Barney LEAPS to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Hello? Hold on... (to Miriam) It's work. Problems on the set.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: When you're done hiding whatever it is you screwed up while I was gone, I'll be in the bedroom. Naked. Miriam exits. Barney takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Morty, so?... oh, thank God. Thank you... okay, bye. He hangs up. He closes his eyes and remains silent and st for a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you off the phone?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Yes, I am. He takes another deep breath to compose himself and exits

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready for some good lovin', Barney walks into the bedroom but stops in his tracks when he sees-- Miriam crying. The phone in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: I don't know why, but I dialed star 69. You were acting so strange... She has to sit down. She's trembling. Terrified.  WHITE 10-23-09 117.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why did you lie about it being Morty on the phone? Tell me the truth - are you sick? (beat) TELL ME.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I'm not sick.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: The way you cough at night, all those cigars--

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Miriam, I'm not sick.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Then what is it? What are you hiding from me? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: It meant nothing to me. Miriam is completely devastated.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please, Miriam. We have a life.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: HAD a life. She storms out. Off Barney, completely shell shocked we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRE-LAP - A KNOCKING at the door The door opens revealing KATE, her eyes filled with tears she throws her arms around Barney and won't let go.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Easy, kiddo. (beat) Let's not mourn just yet. Morty says I've got at least a year before I'm totally bonkers. He has to gently pry her arms from around his neck.  WHITE 10-23-09 118.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your mother's show is on. Why don't you fix us a couple drinks. You could use one. She nods - that's for sure. She starts toward the kitchen

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you talked to her yet?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Don't worry her with anything. Okay? Kate nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barney's sitting at his desk. His eyes drifting over old photographs and items of nostalgia. The final bars of Leo Cohen's "I'm Your Man" playing on Miriam's radio show.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That was Leonard Cohen's "I'm Your Man" - a request from our ever faithful listener, Alphonse, all the way from Montreal. And here's one for you Alphonse - "I Don't Want To Hear It Anymore" by Dusty Springfield. Barney grins. Kate is standing in the door watching him. She steps in a hands him his drink.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Here you go, Alphonse. Barney looks at her with surprise. Kate exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Movers carry boxes down the hallway to the elevator. Barn steps aside to let Michael past with a box in hand. Micha won't even look at his father. We follow Barney back insi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the apartment and into the kitchen where Kate is helping to pack. Her eyes puffy from crying.  WHITE 10-23-09 119. Barney paces back and forth. Back and forth. Michael walks in to grab another box. He won't even look his father.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Michael, wait. (beat) I know how difficult this is for both of you, but your mother and I will work through this.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Do you even understand what you did here?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Then how could you have fucked this up? How? She deserved so much better but she still loved you, you miserable, ungrateful prick

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Watch your mouth. I'm still your father.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: There's nothing I can do about that. Barney SLAPS Michael. It's so utterly shocking to both of them, that no one can move or say a word. Michael then storms out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH -- Barney shatters a framed photo, tearing the room apart. Kate runs in and tries to stop him, but it's hard get past his flailing arms.

dialogues.speaker: DADDY, STOP, PLEASE, STOP
dialogues.text: He finally stops. Kate is unsure what to do. He just stares at the TELEPHONE RECEIVER in his hand. He looks up her. His eyes filled with tears.  WHITE 10-23-09 120.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I can't remember your mother's number.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE
dialogues.text: DING. The elevator doors open revealing Solange, carrying two cups of coffee. She walks down the hallway to Barney' apartment and lets herself in with a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She enters and sets the coffees down.

dialogues.speaker: SOLANGE
dialogues.text: (calling out) Allo? You better be decent.

dialogues.speaker: TIME
dialogues.text: Barney's side of the closet is filled with his clothes, w the other that once held Miriam's wardrobe is completely Barney, in his best suit, is trying but unable to do his tie. His frustration finally boils over.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Goddamn it! He sees Solange in the doorway watching him.

dialogues.speaker: SOLANGE
dialogues.text: Here, let me do it. She steps to him and does his tie. They say nothing. He won't make eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: SOLANGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There. As handsome as you've ever been. Barney double checks the knot in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: SOLANGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's time to go. She walks out first. He takes one last look in the mirror  WHITE 10-23-09 121.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barney sitting at his table in the Ritz Garden, drinking glass of sparkling water His breath is taken away when he sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miriam entering the garden. Every bit as gorgeous, elegan and graceful as she ever was. Barney sits tight, taking advantage of every second he ha to simply watch her. She sees him and smiles as she approaches the table.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: You look great.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You look fantastic. They play through an awkward exchange of leaning in for a kiss, and shaking hands before Barney just takes her into his arms and hugs her. They sit.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: You're not going to get sick on me again, are you?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Only coffee for me now. But I do have crib notes... (pulls out a paper) My address and number, Kate's numbers, Solange -- all the important stuff in case I get lost. I was actually thinking a dog collar might be easier She tries to laugh, but has to fight off tears instead.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: I've been doing some research. They're always coming out with new treatments and trials--

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Let's not do that whole thing. We all know where this is going. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: We can be friends now, can't we?  WHITE 10-23-09 122.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: No. We can't.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: I'm here for you if you'll let me. We had a beautiful marriage, but it's over. I want you to be at peace with that.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Have I ever given up when it comes to you?

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Never.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: So what makes you think I would start now? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: Bonjour, are you ready to hear the specials of the day?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: CU
dialogues.text: Barney and Miriam each have one. They grin with anticipat Miriam slices through the moist, warm chocolate sponge. Carries it past her lips and savors... Mmmm. Heaven. She opens her eyes to see-- BARNEY'S HAND hovering above his cutlery. He can't rememb which one he is supposed to use. Miriam hands him his fork.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Thank you. And they eat cake.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Would you excuse me? I have to use the ladies room?  WHITE 10-23-09 123.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miriam crying in a stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miriam returns from the washroom and is panicked when Bar is missing from the table. She races over to Jean.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Jean, did you see Barney?

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: No, Madame, he paid the bill, but forgot his wallet on the table. Jean hands her Barney's old, beat up WALLET. A SMALL PIECE OF PAPER is sticking out of the wallet. Wit thinking why - she pulls it out. The paper old and cracke She carefully unfolds it--

dialogues.speaker: "CANADIENS 2 BRUINS 1 IN OVERTIME. CONGRATULATIONS. MIRIA
dialogues.text: It's the note she passed to him the night they first met. He's carried this on him all these years. Seeing it liter takes her breath away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She enters the same hall where she and Barney first met. Barney is standing there, grinning from ear to ear as if nothing is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: I couldn't find you, I got so scared.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: It's beautiful in here isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: You forgot your wallet at the table.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Look at you, you're practically shaking.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: I thought I lost you.  WHITE 10-23-09 124.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Lost me? Hey, the kids are gone, why don't we go home, curl up in bed, watch a movie... Miriam cocks her head, wondering why he said that.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: The kids...?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, the kids. You're the one who dropped them off at school. Are you okay? (off her crying) Oh my love, don't cry. He pulls her close. She falls into his embrace, having realized he's forgotten they ever split up.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have I not loved you enough today? She buries her face in his neck to stop from completely breaking down.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what do you say? Can we play hooky? She can't bring herself to shatter his fragile reality.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Let's get you home. He takes her by the arm and walks her out of the lobby, a happy as he's ever been.

dialogues.speaker: ON TV
dialogues.text: OVER IMAGES of the mountain, Boogie's bones with snorkel flippers and goggles, and Barney:

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: It was in a ravine on Mount Orford that Hydro workers stumbled upon the remains of Bernard "Boogie" (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Moscovitch, who went missing over thirty years ago. His friend, Barney Panofsky, producer of the long running soap "O'Malley Of The North", was the only suspect in the case.

dialogues.speaker: PATHOLOGIST
dialogues.text: Our findings show that Mr. Moscovitch died from either being severely beaten with a blunt instrument or had fallen from a considerable height. There were NO gunshot wounds whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: O' HEARNE
dialogues.text: Just because he didn't shoot him, doesn't mean he didn't kill him. This just brings us one step closer to proving the truth. A LONG SHOT OF THE HILLSIDE WHERE THE REMAINS WERE FOUND.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Police say the pathologist's findings don't shed any new light onto who may have been responsible for this death -- As the report continues we PULL OUT from the TV into--

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: (on TV) But at least one part of a thirty year mystery has finally been solved. Where Kate is pouring them each a tea. Michael has a thic DOCUMENT in his hands that he's looking over

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Okay, what is this regular payment out of the company? Kate takes the document.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (laughs) Oh, that. For years now, Daddy has been paying some guy to make up those fake tabloid items about Solange.  WHITE 10-23-09 126.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I don't know. To make her feel good. He even had them faxed from Bulgaria, just in case she checked the number. Daddy asked me to keep it going. Kate drips honey into her tea. Hands it to Michael.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: (smelling honey) Is this honey still good?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Honey doesn't go bad.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Ever?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Ever.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Where did you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I don't remember, but it's true. Michael uses the honey and follows Kate out to the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where they pass the well known sketch by Clara.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: I can't believe he's leaving that to her.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: As if running out on their wedding to chase mom wasn't enough of a rub. You know she hated that thing?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: She's not gonna hate it when she finds out how much it's worth. They continue out to the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOUNDS OF PAPERWORK everywhere. Michael and Kate sit. He passes her a flagged contract from one of the paper piles  WHITE 10-23-09 127. While she signs the pages, Michael looks out onto the lak It's a picture perfect day.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: What do you want to do about the cottage?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: We're never selling this cottage.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Yeah. I agree. She finishes signing the agreement. Hands it back. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Okay, done. What's next?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: (reading) "To my wife, Miriam Grant Panofsky, I leave our city condo, the original painting by my late friend, Leo Fasoli, and the adjoining plot to my own in Mount Royal cemetery where my wish is for her to buried along side me" (beat) He shouldn't have included that. It's not fair to her. She's married to Blair.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Only until death do them part.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: There's one last thing, but it's not relevant anymore. He left Boogie money to publish any original writings of his choosing when he should return.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: See? He always hoped Boogie would come back.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: That doesn't mean anything.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Of course it does. Why would he leave Boogie money if he killed him?  WHITE 10-23-09 128.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: So no one would think he did.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Stop it. He didn't do it. Why can't you let go of this already?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: You brought it up. I'm just saying that we'll never really know what happened.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: He's our father. What else do you need to know? It's a touchy subject he'd rather not get into. Michael stares out at the lake --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY sitting on a lawn chair by the lake.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: I'm going to go down to the lake. Michael exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael walks to the lake and sits beside BARNEY. Barney's mind is now almost completely gone. He doesn't even react to Michael's presence. Barney is slowly trying to peel a BANANA from the WRONG E

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Try it this way. Michael turns the Banana over for him. Barney looks at it oddly. Turns it back over again. Michael and Barney look out ACROSS THE LAKE where a young family with two children play with a BEACH BALL in the wa From here they look much like Barney's family did years a Michael takes out a cigar from his breast pocket. Clips a lights it.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here, just don't tell Kate. He exchanges the banana for the cigar. Barney is able to smoke it just fine.  WHITE 10-23-09 129. Michael hears a RUMBLING in the distance. He spots a WATE PLANE approaching. His eyes light up with excitement. The plane descends toward the lake. Floating in the middl of the lake is the BEACH BALL, having gotten away from th young family previously. The plane's HULL opens and SWALLOWS up water, ALONG WITH BEACH BALL. It pulls back up into the sky, the hull close

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you remember how much we loved that when we were kids? The WATER PLANE is still in the air and has begun to swin back around. It opens its hull and drops its water load - along with t BEACH BALL onto the side of a MOUNTAIN which we can easil identify as the spot where they found Boogie's remains. Watching this, it suddenly comes together for Michael.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Boogie... Oh my God... dad, did you see that? He turns to Barney who, much to his surprise, is watching the plane too. Barney continues to puff on his cigar, but his thoughts, any, are a mystery to all.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, dad... I'm so sorry... Michael takes his father's hand, holding it, then pressin it to his forehead just as Barney did with Izzy when he d

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Standing on the deck, watching them. Tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright, green leaves on a tree moving with a gentle breez A perfect blue sky behind them. Blades of thick, green grass flutter. The sounds of footsteps on a rocky path. MOVING WITH MIRIAM - as she slowly walks uphill carrying fresh flowers.  WHITE 10-23-09 130.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches the highest peak on the only hillside in the cemetery. A view of the entire city. Maybe the most picturesque spot ever. She mutters a silent prayer before laying the flowers dow Her eyes moist with tears, she grazes the tombstone with fingertips, then starts back down the hill. We remain on the hillside and move toward the grave.... t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ACROSS the DOUBLE HEADSTONE - beside Barney's name is written --
